en: What's Scotland like in summer?
zh: 苏格兰夏天是什么样的？

en: I would like to join the summer camp.
St Mark's Square in Venice is always swarming with tourists in the summer.
zh: 威尼斯的圣马可广场在夏天总是挤满了游客。

en: I like everything that comes with summer.
I have to write a paper of more than 10 pages for my summer homework.
zh: 我的暑假作业得写一篇十多页的论文。

en: We can see a lot of stars at night in summer.
zh: 夏天的晚上能看到很多星星。

en: Please conserve water in summer.
Grass is luxuriant in summer.
The town was deluged with tourists in summer.
zh: 夏天那个小镇挤满了游客。

en: In summer, European people enjoy long holidays.
zh: 欧洲人夏天喜欢休长假。

en: We have much rain in summer but on the other hand we have little rain in winter.
zh: 我们这里夏天雨水多，冬天雨水少。

en: In summer, we used to go swimming in the river.
zh: 以前夏天我们常去河里游泳。

en: Tourists take over this island in the summer.
zh: 夏天游客就占领了整个岛。

en: In summer, we enjoy outdoor sports.
zh: 夏天我们喜欢户外运动。

en: In summer, they used to play on the beach all day long.
zh: 以前夏天他们整天都在沙滩上玩。

en: In the long summer days she sat in the sun and watched the trees cover themselves with leaves, and the white daisies cover the hill.
zh: 在漫长的夏日里，她坐在阳光下，看着树木长满绿叶，漫山遍野开满了白色的雏菊。

en: In the summer, people go to the seaside.
I often go swimming at the beach in the summer.
zh: 夏天我经常去海边游泳。

en: It gets hot and humid in summer.
Did you go anywhere for the summer?
Which do you like better, summer or winter?
zh: 夏天和冬天你更喜欢哪一个？

en: What do you associate with summer?
zh: 提到夏天你会想到什么？

en: Summer has come.
The summer drew near to its end.
Plant these seeds before summer sets in.
zh: 趁夏天还没到，把这些种子种下去。

en: When summer is over, the days grow shorter and shorter.
zh: 夏天过后，白天就越来越短了。

en: In England, in the summer, the sun rises at about 4 a.m.
zh: 在英国，夏天的太阳早上四点左右就升起来了。

en: The alternative possibilities are neutrality or war.
zh: 除了中立，另一种可能就是开战。

en: Take every possible means.
I want to go on a journey around the world if possible.
zh: 如果可能的话，我想环游世界。

en: I'd send my kid out on his own for a while if I were you. A few hard knocks at this point might do him some good.
zh: 如果我是你，我会让他自己出去闯闯，这时候吃点苦头对他有好处。

en: Some member countries have been lax in abiding by G-7 agreements.
zh: 一些成员国在遵守七国集团协议方面表现得很松懈。

en: Was Ms. Kato your teacher last year?
zh: 加藤老师去年是你的老师吗？

en: Mr. Kato teaches us English.
Mr Kato, who lives in Paris, misses his family left at home.
zh: 住在巴黎的加藤先生很想念家里的亲人。

en: Kato asked him many questions about the United States.
zh: 加藤问了他很多关于美国的问题。

en: Kato's class consists of forty boys and girls.
zh: 加藤的班里有四十个男生和女生。

en: Allow me to introduce Mr Kato to you.
zh: 请允许我向您介绍加藤先生。

en: Mr Kato was too old to work any longer.
zh: 加藤先生年纪太大了，没法再工作了。

en: Mr Kato is a teacher.
I live in Kakogawa.
It is difficult to relate to someone who has different values from you.
zh: 很难跟价值观不同的人相处。

en: Some stores discount the price.
We must cut down on prices; we can't compete.
zh: 我们必须降价，不然没法竞争。

en: I'll agree to the terms if you lower the price.
zh: 如果你降价，我就同意这些条款。

en: The prices are subject to change without notice.
zh: 价格如有变动，恕不另行通知。

en: Prices are subject to change without notice.
zh: 价格如有变动，恕不另行通知。

en: The price reflects the demand.
The price varies with demand.
Prices depend on supply and demand.
The price is double what it was last year.
zh: 现在的价格是去年的两倍。

en: Prices seem to be going down.
Price depends on costs and demand.
zh: 价格取决于成本和需求。

en: What is the price?
If your prices are competitive, we will place a large order.
zh: 如果你们的价格有竞争力，我们会订个大单。

en: Prices range from the low $30 to the high $50.
zh: 价格在30多到50多美元之间。

en: I'd like to discuss pricing with you.
The price includes the postage charge.
The price does not include the case.
The price doesn't include consumption tax.
Observe his facial reaction when we mention a price.
zh: 我们提价格的时候，注意一下他的表情。

en: Demand for imported cars is increasing due to lower prices.
zh: 因为价格降了，进口车的需求正在增加。

en: Who do you think you are?
He emphasized that tens of thousands of people would come to that concert.
zh: 他强调说会有好几万人去听那场演唱会。

en: How many exposures would you like?
Do you have any CDs?
There are several flowers. One is red, another is white, and the others are yellow.
zh: 这里有几朵花。一朵是红的，一朵是白的，其余的是黄的。

en: Minutes or hours later Dr. Numata came in and felt Sadako's forehead.
zh: 过了几分钟或是几个小时，沼田医生进来摸了摸祯子的额头。

en: How long is the ride?
No scam is too outrageous.
zh: 再离谱的骗局都不足为奇。

en: Millions of people can see more games than when they have to attend each one in person.
zh: 数百万人能看到的比赛比他们亲自去现场看的还要多。

en: Millions of trees have been cut down for fuel.
zh: 数百万棵树被砍下来当燃料。

en: Hundreds of people work in this factory.
zh: 好几百人在这个工厂工作。

en: Hundreds of people were waiting outside the ticket office.
zh: 好几百人在售票处外面等着。

en: Hundreds of boys are playing in the ground.
zh: 几百个男孩在操场上玩耍。

en: We shot pheasants by the hundred.
Hundreds of people were on the spot.
Hundreds of people called or wrote to the Gorilla Foundation.
zh: 成百上千的人给大猩猩基金会打电话或写信。

en: Hundreds of buffaloes moved toward the lake.
zh: 几百头水牛朝湖边移动。

en: I saw some monkeys climbing the tree.
zh: 我看到几只猴子在爬树。

en: What number bus do I take?
How many nights would you like the room for?
For how many nights?
After a couple of drinks, the guy was feeling no pain.
zh: 喝了几杯之后，那家伙就醉得飘飘然了。

en: Lately, I've been letting my English go. It seems I'll never improve at it, no matter how many years I study.
zh: 最近我把英语荒废了。好像不管学多少年，我都不会有长进。

en: For years Marina had been inspecting houses.
zh: 多年来，玛丽娜一直在看房子。

en: I haven't seen him for years.
Years of farm work have hardened his body.
zh: 多年的农活让他的身体变得很结实。

en: For years the picture passed as a genuine Rembrandt.
zh: 多年来，这幅画一直被认为是伦勃朗的真迹。

en: I wonder if she will recognize me after all those years.
zh: 我在想，过了这么多年，她还能不能认出我。

en: How long have you been studying English?
Some years ago, learning that one had tuberculosis amounted to hearing a sentence of death.
zh: 几年前，得知患上肺结核就等于是接到了死亡通知单。

en: Years ago, she used to hang around with a bunch of bikers.
zh: 多年前，她常和一群飞车党混在一起。

en: How long are you going to stay?
You might have to eat those words a few years from now.
zh: 几年后，你可能得收回这些话。

en: How early do I have to make a reservation to qualify for the discount?
zh: 我要提前多久预订才能享受折扣？

en: Can you hike for days in the wilderness without seeing anyone?
zh: 你能在荒野中徒步几天却见不到一个人吗？

en: It snowed for many days together.
It rained for several days on end.
How long are you going to stay here?
How long will you be gone?
How many days does it usually take to get there?
About how many days will it take to get there?
How long will it take?
If I've told you once, I've told you a thousand times.
zh: 这话我都跟你说了一千遍了。

en: Having heard it so many times, I can recite the poem by heart now.
zh: 听了这么多遍，这首诗我都能背下来了。

en: Having failed many times, he never gave up the plan.
zh: 失败了很多次，但他一直没放弃那个计划。

en: Many times have I scolded him.
He has lied to me again and again.
Some books are worth reading over and over again.
Having lost the game over and over again, he finally gave in.
zh: 输了一次又一次，他最后终于认输了。

en: Having visited Rome many times, he knows about it well.
zh: 他去过很多次罗马，对那儿熟得很。

en: Read it again and again.
I tried again and again, but I couldn't succeed.
zh: 我试了一次又一次，但还是没成功。

en: After several delays, the plane finally left.
zh: 延误了好几次，飞机总算起飞了。

en: I've seen one many times.
Many animals that lived thousands of years ago are now extinct.
zh: 很多几千年前存在的动物现在都灭绝了。

en: Thousands of people were milling around in the square.
zh: 广场上有成千上万的人在转悠。

en: Thousands of people gathered there.
Thousands of people wanted to know the answer.
zh: 成千上万的人都想知道答案。

en: Thousands of foreigners visit Japan every year.
zh: 每年有成千上万的外国人去日本旅游。

en: Thousands of stars shone in the heavens.
zh: 天上有无数颗星星在闪烁。

en: Thousands of people were there.
Thousands of people visited the city.
zh: 好几千人参观了这座城市。

en: Thousands of spectators got very excited.
zh: 成千上万的观众都非常激动。

en: Thousands of people died of hunger.
Thousands of Americans have a hard time keeping the wolf from the door.
zh: 成千上万的美国人连糊口都难。

en: Some boats are on the lake.
As the centuries went by and England became more crowded, the people found their food supply a great problem.
zh: 随着几个世纪过去，英国变得越来越拥挤，食物供应成了人们的一大难题。

en: How many staff members filed to change departments?
How many people in your party?
No man can be a patriot on an empty stomach.
zh: 肚子不填饱，谁也当不了爱国者。

en: No man is the wiser for his learning.
zh: 学得多不代表就更聪明。

en: No one can be more wise than destiny.
How many people are in this room?
How many children do you have?
How many people are there on the payroll?
How many engineers took part in the conference?
zh: 有多少工程师参加了会议？

en: How many people?
Let no one appropriate a common benefit.
zh: 谁也不许私吞公共利益。

en: How many people do you think have an ear for music?
zh: 你觉得有多少人懂音乐？

en: Some were late.
How many people are now living in poverty?
zh: 现在有多少人生活在贫困中？

en: Some brave passengers caught the pickpocket and turned him over to the police.
zh: 几个勇敢的乘客抓住了小偷，把他交给了警察。

en: We ought to expect some casual visitors.
zh: 估计会有一些临时来访的客人。

en: Some boys came into the classroom.
Some people tried to dig the treasure out, but they couldn't.
zh: 有些人想把宝藏挖出来，但没成功。

en: Several people have been accused of breaking the law.
Some children brought peanut butter sandwiches, some ham, and others cheese.
zh: 有的孩子带了花生酱三明治，有的带了火腿的，还有的带了奶酪的。

en: Some of the boys are fishing and the others are swimming.
zh: 男生里有的在钓鱼，有的在游泳。

en: Some of the drivers were laughing and yelling.
zh: 有些司机在那儿又笑又叫的。

en: I can see some people walking across the street.
Somebody caught me by the arm.
Some were playing tennis on the tennis court.
zh: 有些人在网球场打网球。

en: What newspaper do you take?
Wherever you go, you will find the same thing.
zh: 无论你到哪儿，情况都一样。

en: I don't know where we'll arrive.
zh: 我不知道我们会到哪儿。

en: Getting nowhere.
You can go anywhere you want.
Where can I buy a ticket?
You may sit wherever you like.
Dozens of young people attended the demonstration.
zh: 好几十个年轻人参加了游行。

en: Dozens of houses were burned down in that big fire.
zh: 那场大火烧掉了好几十栋房子。

en: It rained after it had been dry for many weeks.
zh: 旱了好几个星期，终于下雨了。

en: Many kinds of birds live in Japan.
Many kinds of flowers will come out soon.
zh: 很多种花很快就要开了。

en: She screamed with horror as someone took hold of her arm.
zh: 有人抓住她胳膊时，她吓得尖叫起来。

en: Somebody had drowned her in the bathtub.
zh: 有人在浴缸里把她淹死了。

en: What time does it close?
What make of computer do you use?
He had been walking for hours.
zh: 他已经走了好几个小时了。

en: After being frightened for many hours, her mother finally saved her.
zh: 在担惊受怕了好几个小时后，她妈妈终于救了她。

en: He was worn out after hours of work.
zh: 工作了好几个小时，他累坏了。

en: I felt tired from having worked for hours.
zh: 干了好几个小时活儿，我觉得挺累的。

en: It's painful to keep sitting for hours.
zh: 一坐就是好几个小时，真难受。

en: I gazed at the sea for hours.
zh: 我盯着大海看了好几个小时。

en: We've been waiting for hours for you to show up.
zh: 我们等了你好几个小时你才露面。

en: It rained for hours and hours.
zh: 雨下个不停，下了好几个小时。

en: I have tried for hours to remember where I put my keys, but it has completely escaped me.
zh: 我想了好几个小时都没记起钥匙放哪儿了，完全想不起来了。

en: It was many hours before he came to.
zh: 过了好几个小时他才醒过来。

en: What time does it open?
When was it finished?
"What time would you like that for?" "Two o'clock would be good."
A fox is not caught twice in the same snare.
zh: 狐狸不会在同一个陷阱里掉两次。

en: How late can I check in?
What time does this train reach Yokohama?
It became dark before I knew it.
What time can you come?
When should we make reservations?
What time did she check out of the hotel?
What time does boarding begin?
When do I get there?
What time do you go to bed?
What time did you eat?
What time does it start?
What time is dinner?
What time are you leaving?
What time will the game start?
What time is our train arriving at Hakata?
zh: 我们的火车几点到博多？

en: What time shall I pick you up?
What time do you get up?
When did you get up?
When will you come home?
What time does it open and close?
What time should I leave the hotel?
What time will the bus pick us up?
What time and where could we meet?
When should we check out?
What time should I check in?
Can you please tell me what time the train leaves?
Do you know what time the shop is closed?
What time did you arrive there?
What time can I be there?
What time shall we make it?
What time?
What time shall I come?
Do you know what day it is?
Do you know what the time is?
About what time?
When are you going on summer vacation?
What time do you start check-in?
What time will be right for you?
When is it convenient for you?
When will you be back?
The will is as good as the deed.
Whatever we may undertake, diligence is important.
zh: 不管做什么，勤奋都很重要。

en: Everything eventually gets easier with practice.
Nothing is as precious as friendship.
Nothing can prevent her from marrying him.
Nothing can be gained without effort.
Resignation is the first lesson of life.
zh: 学会顺从是人生的第一课。

en: Don't do anything by halves.
You cannot have your way in everything.
Whatever you're doing, starting off on the right foot is essential.
zh: 不管做什么，开个好头很重要。

en: He smoked as if nothing had happened.
zh: 他跟没事人一样在那抽烟。

en: Nothing happened.
All things must have an end.
Don't carry anything to excess.
Moderation in all things.
Try to have a positive attitude about everything.
Take a mean position in everything.
Do your best in everything.
One has to do one's best in anything.
You should do your best in everything.
Keep in mind that there's no royal road to anything.
Try your best in everything.
You must not go to extremes in anything.
Be the matter what it may, we must persevere.
zh: 不管发生什么，我们都要坚持到底。

en: Whatever may happen.
Should anything arise, she will be prepared for it.
zh: 万一出什么事，她都有准备。

en: Come what may, I am determined to accomplish it.
zh: 不管发生什么，我都一定要完成它。

en: I will stand by you whatever happens.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都会挺你的。

en: Everybody was anxious to know what had happened.
zh: 大家都急着想知道发生了什么事。

en: He felt that something was about to happen.
zh: 他觉得好像要出什么事了。

en: Whatever may happen, I am prepared for it.
zh: 不管发生什么，我都做好准备了。

en: I ordered some new books from America.
zh: 我从美国订了几本新书。

en: Where's your head at?
What language is spoken in America?
Why did she interrupt me?
Why didn't you tell her?
What do you think caused him to lose his job?
zh: 你觉得是什么原因让他丢了工作的？

en: I cannot conceive why she has done such a thing.
zh: 我真想不通她干嘛要做出那种事。

en: Do you know why they stopped talking?
zh: 你知道他们为什么不说话了吗？

en: Why didn't you tell it to me in advance?
Why am I shooting these guys, tell me, what have they done?
zh: 我为什么要射杀这些人？告诉我，他们都干了些什么？

en: Why were you silent all the time?
zh: 你刚才怎么一直不说话？

en: How come Mary is going on a picnic with him?
zh: 玛丽怎么会跟他一起去野餐？

en: The reason is because I can speak Chinese.
Why do you think so?
What did you go there for?
Why didn't you come?
What do you mean, why don't I ever say it?
zh: 你什么意思，谁说我从来不提的？

en: What are you talking about!?
Several cottages have been isolated by the flood water.
zh: 洪水把好几座小木屋都给困住了。

en: A casual remark can hurt someone.
zh: 无心的一句话也能伤到人。

en: How often have you been to Europe?
Having failed several times, he tried to do it again.
zh: 失败了好几次之后，他又试了一次。

en: I got sucked in on a lot of phony deals.
zh: 我被好几桩虚假交易给坑了。

en: I got several bites, but could not hook a fish.
zh: 鱼咬了好几次钩，但我一条也没钓上来。

en: How often is it necessary to feed your pet?
zh: 你的宠物多久得喂一次？

en: Which station are you going to?
Some of the birds didn't fly.
What you're talking about is more important than how you say it.
zh: 你说什么比你怎么说更重要。

en: What's biting you?
What did you buy?
You have to read between the lines to get the most out of anything.
zh: 你得读懂言外之意才能真正领会。

en: What are you reading?
What are you cross about?
What was stolen?
What was it I left behind?
What shall I go in?
It's not what you wear, it's how you wear it.
zh: 穿什么不重要，重要的是你怎么穿。

en: What're you waiting for?
What are you concerned about?
What's your major?
What are you laughing at?
What should I eat?
What trifles are you making a great fuss about?
zh: 就这点小事，你至于这么大惊小怪吗？

en: We disputed for hours about what to write.
zh: 我们为了该写什么争论了好几个小时。

en: You should make sure of the facts before you write something.
zh: 动笔写之前，你应该先把事实搞清楚。

en: What should I bring?
What did you make?
A penny for your thoughts.
What do you think you're doing?
zh: 你觉得自己这是在干嘛？

en: How about telling me what you have in mind?
zh: 要不你跟我说说你是怎么想的？

en: What are you thinking about?
Not knowing what to say, he remained silent.
zh: 他不知道该说什么，就沉默了。

en: Not knowing what to say, she remained silent.
zh: 她不知道该说什么，就没吭声。

en: I'm at a loss for what to say.
zh: 我都不知道该说什么好了。

en: What to say is more important than how to say it.
zh: 说什么比怎么说更重要。

en: What do you mean?
Not knowing what to see, I asked him for advice.
zh: 我不知道该看什么，就请他给我点建议。

en: What are you going to see?
No matter what he plays on the screen, Tom looks great.
zh: 不管汤姆演什么，都很帅。

en: What will you have to drink?
No matter what you do, do your best.
zh: 不管做什么，都要全力以赴。

en: It's no use trying anything.
What are you about?
I wonder what they have in store for us under the big top?
zh: 我挺好奇大帐篷里会给咱们准备点什么？

en: My view is different from his as to what should be done.
zh: 关于该怎么做，我的想法跟他不一样。

en: Why are you so happy?
What makes you so sad?
In doing anything, do your best.
Whatever you do, carry it through.
zh: 不管做什么，都要坚持到底。

en: And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men.
zh: 无论做什么，都要全心全意，就像是为主做的，而不是为人做的。

en: No matter what you do, you must follow the correct order.
zh: 不管做什么，都得按顺序来。

en: You should make as much effort as possible in whatever you do.
zh: 无论做什么，都应该尽最大努力。

en: We need money to do anything.
Whatever you do, you must do your best.
zh: 无论做什么，都必须全力以赴。

en: It is up to you to decide what to do.
I'm doubtful about what I ought to do.
zh: 我不知道我该做什么好。

en: Not knowing what to do, I called my mother for advice.
zh: 我不知道该怎么办，就给我妈打了个电话。

en: My view was different from his as to what should be done.
zh: 对于该怎么做，我的想法跟他不一样。

en: Nobody could decide as to what to do.
zh: 谁也没法决定该怎么做。

en: I must think about what to do.
You are sure to succeed, whatever you do.
zh: 不管你做什么，都肯定会成功。

en: Whatever you may do, you must do your best.
zh: 无论你做什么，都要尽力而为。

en: What shall we play?
It is clear what must be done.
zh: 该怎么做已经很清楚了。

en: What do you do to pass the time?
Not knowing what to do, I stood there silently.
zh: 我不知道该怎么办，就默不作声地站在那儿。

en: Not knowing what to do, I asked for his advice.
zh: 我不知道该怎么做，就去问了他的建议。

en: Let me know what you're up to.
zh: 跟我也说说你在忙什么呢。

en: Not knowing what to do, I did nothing.
zh: 我不知道该做什么，索性就什么都没干。

en: I don't have the slightest idea what to do.
zh: 我完全不知道该怎么办。

en: Tell me what to do.
What do you want to do?
Please telephone me when you have made up your mind what you want to do.
zh: 你决定好想做什么后，请给我打个电话。

en: May I help you ma'am?
zh: 您好，有什么我能帮您的吗？

en: What's eating you?
zh: 你怎么了？什么事让你不顺心？

en: What's taking you so long?
What would you like to drink?
I can't understand what you're trying to get at.
zh: 我不太明白你到底想说什么。

en: I have a very vague idea of what you are talking about.
zh: 我大概知道你在说什么，但不是很清楚。

en: Not knowing what to say, I remained silent.
zh: 我不知道该说什么，就一直没说话。

en: Thank you all the same.
For some reason or other she shook her head.
zh: 不知道为什么，她摇了摇头。

en: Reflect on your own motives when making a decision.
zh: 做决定的时候，好好想想你到底是怎么想的。

en: Because of some technical problem, a movie was shown in place of the announced program.
zh: 因为技术问题，原本预定的节目改成了放电影。

en: What is most important is your strong will to master English.
zh: 最重要的是你想学好英语的决心。

en: The most important thing is thinking for oneself.
zh: 最重要的是要独立思考。

en: Above all, you must take good care of yourself.
zh: 最重要的是，你要照顾好自己。

en: I love to jog more than anything else in the world.
zh: 我这辈子最喜欢跑步了。

en: What I need worst is a haircut.
zh: 我最该做的就是去理个发。

en: Duty should come before anything else.
The one resource more precious than any other was land.
zh: 土地是比什么都珍贵的资源。

en: You should put safety before everything else.
zh: 你要把安全放在第一位。

en: We must put safety before anything else.
zh: 我们必须把安全放在第一位。

en: Chiefly, I want you to be more frank.
zh: 主要是，我希望你能更坦诚一点。

en: You must, above all, be faithful to your friends.
zh: 最重要的是，你得对朋友真诚。

en: Best of all, he learns things fast.
zh: 最棒的是，他学东西很快。

en: Above all, don't tell a lie.
Above all, be patient.
Above all, be true to yourself.
zh: 最重要的是，要做真实的自己。

en: Above all, we must be healthy.
Above all, try to be kind to the old.
zh: 最重要的，要对老人好一点。

en: Above all, watch your diet.
zh: 最重要的是要注意饮食。

en: Above all, you must help each other.
zh: 你们最需要做的就是互相帮助。

en: Above all, I want to see him again.
zh: 我最想做的就是再见他一面。

en: Above all, take care of yourself.
Are you sure you haven't forgotten anything?
zh: 你确定没落掉什么东西吗？

en: Not having heard from him, I wrote to him again.
zh: 一直没收到他的信，我就又给他写了一封。

en: That won't change anything.
You have nothing to fear.
You have no need to be ashamed.
It is no use your pretending that you know nothing.
zh: 你假装什么都不知道也没用。

en: Having nothing, nothing can he lose.
zh: 他一无所有，也没什么好失去的。

en: There is nothing to worry about.
Nothing can force me to give it up.
There is no hurry.
I could not see anything.
I have no real intent.
Nothing's gonna change my world.
zh: 没什么能改变我的世界。

en: Those who possess nothing lose nothing.
zh: 一无所有的人，也不会失去什么。

en: Above all, I want to be healthy.
zh: 我最想要的就是身体健康。

en: Nothing is to be compared to its beauty.
I don't feel like anything.
Having nothing to do, he went downtown.
zh: 反正也没事干，他就去市中心了。

en: Having nothing to do, I watched television.
zh: 闲着没事，我就看了会儿电视。

en: There's nothing to do, so I may as well go to bed.
zh: 也没啥事，我还是去睡觉吧。

en: Work is preferable to idleness.
Don't cry before you're hurt.
You can wear my scarf as long as you don't spill anything on it.
zh: 围巾可以借你戴，只要别弄脏了就行。

en: Everything points to his guilt.
zh: 种种迹象都说明是他干的。

en: Those who forget everything are happy.
You had better tell me the whole story.
zh: 你最好把整件事儿原原本本地告诉我。

en: He looked as if he knew all about it.
zh: 他看着就跟什么都知道似的。

en: Sometimes everything goes wrong.
Everything seemed to go wrong with me.
zh: 我感觉那阵子我干什么都不顺。

en: Everything is now ready for you.
You didn't leave me shit.
Everything went better than I had expected.
zh: 事情进展得比我想象的还要顺。

en: No one shall be held in slavery.
Before everything you should take better care of your health.
zh: 首先，你得先照顾好自己的身体。

en: What were we talking about?
What does this stand for?
It is good for nothing.
zh: 这玩意儿一点儿用都没有。

en: For what purpose did he come here?
zh: 他来这儿到底是干嘛的？

en: Few people are free of care.
What do I have?
What thought do you think had the biggest impact on the English in the Middle Ages?
zh: 你觉得什么思想对中世纪英语的影响最大？

en: By what authority do you order me to do this?
zh: 你凭什么命令我干这个？

en: Who are you to tell me to get out?
zh: 你算老几，凭什么让我滚？

en: What flower do you like best?
Never hesitate to tell the truth.
What made her so sad?
What do you play baseball for?
Why did her father go to Japan?
zh: 她爸爸去日本干嘛去了？

en: What on earth do you want six copies of the same book for?
zh: 你到底为什么要买六本一模一样的书啊？

en: What are you working for?
What did you buy this expensive dictionary for?
zh: 你买这么贵的词典干嘛用？

en: What do you learn English for?
What did you buy it for?
For what?
What kind of sandwich do you want?
zh: 你想要什么样的三明治？

en: What for?
The allusion was not lost on me.
What will you have to eat?
Just tell me what you'd like me to do.
zh: 你就直接跟我说想让我干嘛就行。

en: I will be glad if I can serve you in any way.
zh: 要是能帮上忙，我挺开心的。

en: In fact, I'll even call George at the office and tell him he ought to come home and help out.
zh: 实际上，我甚至会给在办公室的乔治打电话，让他回家来帮帮忙。

en: What a fine day it is!
What a good teacher Mr Hirayama is!
zh: 平山老师真是个好老师！

en: How well Mr Hirayama teaches!
What a dishonest fellow!
What a beautiful rainbow!
What lovely flowers!
I don't know how to reply to that question.
zh: 我不知道该怎么回那个问题。

en: What a big supermarket!
What a lazy teacher!
How wonderful a time we have had!
How well she is singing!
How serious I looked!
zh: 我当时看起来可真够严肃的！

en: What a pity!
What splendid houses they are!
I am at a loss for what I have to say.
zh: 我都不知道该说什么好了。

en: I didn't know what to say.
zh: 我当时不知道该说什么。

en: Let me have your suggestion as to what I am to say.
How blue the sky is!
He exclaimed, "What a dirty face you have!"
zh: 他叫道：“你的脸怎么这么脏啊！”

en: I can't say for sure.
What an incredible amount of work he has done!
I can't say.
I have no words to express my gratitude.
zh: 我都不知道该怎么谢你了。

en: I sort of understand.
Boy, did she have egg on her face when she showed up at the formal party wearing blue jeans!
zh: 天哪，她穿着牛仔裤去参加正式派对，真是丢死人了！

en: How fast the plane is!
I must save her at all costs.
zh: 我一定要不惜一切代价救她。

en: What a marvelous sight!
What a heavenly dress!
We must prevent war at any cost.
zh: 我们必须不惜一切代价阻止战争。

en: We've got to break out tonight or I'll go crazy!
zh: 我们今晚得逃出去，不然我要疯了！

en: I ache for a sight of the sea.
I must save the drowning child by all means.
zh: 我必须想尽办法救那个落水的孩子。

en: We must prevent the fire from reaching the gunpowder at any cost.
zh: 无论如何我们都得防止火烧到火药。

en: She managed to learn to drive a car.
I managed to find his office.
zh: 我好不容易才找到他的办公室。

en: Will you make every effort to come?
I'll manage to fit you in next week.
zh: 我下周争取给你挤点时间出来。

en: We just got to first base.
I tried everything to keep him alive.
zh: 我想尽一切办法想让他活下来。

en: I'll get my son to wash my car somehow or other.
zh: 我总有办法让我儿子去洗车的。

en: I hope I can manage to make both ends meet.
zh: 我希望能勉强维持收支平衡。

en: Let's try to arrange something.
zh: 咱们商量着安排一下吧。

en: Could you make time for me?
Push the job and get it done this week.
zh: 抓紧点，这周把这活干完。

en: I managed to make myself understood in English.
zh: 我总算能用英语表达清楚了。

en: What a lovely doll!
I think I can handle it.
I'll work that into my tight schedule.
zh: 我会尽量把它挤进我紧凑的日程里。

en: We made it out of there.
Do something!
Get up as early as you possibly can.
Will you manage to repair my car?
I was determined to fulfill my duties at any cost.
zh: 我下定决心要不惜一切代价尽职尽责。

en: Catch as catch can.
Can't you do something to help me?
Please do something about it.
zh: 请想办法处理一下这件事。

en: I'll be there by eight somehow.
zh: 我想办法在八点前赶到。

en: You should struggle so hard to make this program work.
zh: 你得拼命努力让这个程序跑通。

en: I cannot thank you too much.
I beg your pardon?
Not knowing what to say, she just smiled.
zh: 她不知道该说什么，就只是笑笑。

en: I was wrong all the same.
After all, their form of transport produces no pollution at all.
zh: 毕竟他们的交通方式完全没污染。

en: I was at a loss what to say.
zh: 我不知道该说什么才好。

en: What a waste of water!
What a waste of energy!
How slow you are!
So quick!
What made her do so?
You have a lot of nerve!
Hmmm, how shall I say this?
What led you to believe it?
What a cute little girl!
Why me?
How naughty you are! Stop bothering me!
zh: 你也太淘气了！别再烦我了！

en: Ask me anything!
What a good idea!
It's to your advantage to learn everything you can.
zh: 尽可能多学点东西对你有好处。

en: You cannot have your own way in everything.
zh: 你不能事事都随心所欲。

en: We cannot have our own way in everything.
zh: 我们不能事事都随心所欲。

en: You may take anything you like.
Call on us in case of any difficulties.
Help yourself to anything you like.
Please get whatever you like.
Jack of all trades, and master of none.
You can't hope to have your own way in everything.
zh: 你别指望事事都能如愿。

en: Without motivation, nothing can be achieved.
zh: 没动力的话，什么都做不成。

en: It was nothing.
I'll do anything.
Stop making a fuss over nothing.
You shall not have your own way in everything.
zh: 你不能事事都由着自己。

en: Anything will do.
A jack of all trades is a master of none.
Help yourself to anything you'd like to eat.
I am entirely at your service.
I'm sure people would live twice as long if they stopped getting themselves worked up over everything.
zh: 我觉得要是人们不再为各种事瞎操心，寿命肯定能长一倍。

en: Eat whatever you like.
What marvelous weather.
What's it made from?
Come again?
I don't care what you say. It's not going to happen!
zh: 不管你怎么说，反正没门儿！

en: Holy cow!
The men will be happy if they get anything back.
zh: 只要能拿回来点儿东西，那些人就高兴了。

en: I didn't hear what you said.
What's my book doing here?
What an ambiguous expression!
zh: 这话听着也太模棱两可了！

en: I'm sort of tired.
We'll what?
Give me a break. If you have something to say, stop making faces and say it.
zh: 饶了我吧，有话就直说，别在那儿挤眉弄眼的。

en: Say, he is no more than a kid.
What are you going to do?
Because the store is so small, he has to wear many different hats, from accountant to stock boy.
zh: 因为店太小了，他什么活儿都得干，从会计到理货员。

en: We discussed what to do.
zh: 我们讨论了一下该怎么办。

en: Come what may, we must remain cheerful.
zh: 无论发生什么，我们都要保持乐观。

en: How many languages can you speak?
For months, he did almost nothing.
zh: 好几个月了，他几乎什么都没干。

en: I've been going out with her for months.
zh: 我和她交往好几个月了。

en: Do you have anything to talk about?
Won't you give me something cold to drink?
Will you give me something cold to drink?
How about something cold to drink?
I want something cold to drink.
Would you give me something cold to drink?
zh: 可以给我点凉快的东西喝吗？

en: I want to drink something cold.
Have you thought of any good plans?
zh: 你想出什么好主意了吗？

en: He says "want" when he wants something, and "no" when he does not.
zh: 他想要什么就说“要”，不想要就说“不”。

en: Tell me what you want.
I thought you had come on business.
zh: 我以为你是来办正事的。

en: Have you got any plans?
Are you taking any medicine regularly?
zh: 你有在定期吃什么药吗？

en: A certain problem may come about.
Are there any landmarks?
zh: 那儿有什么标志性建筑吗？

en: Don't you smell something unusual?
zh: 你没闻到什么奇怪的味道吗？

en: There should be something for us to talk about.
zh: 我们总得找点话题聊聊。

en: What have you got to say for yourself?
What's new?
She must have sensed something odd.
zh: 她肯定是察觉到什么不对劲了。

en: There must be another way.
I smell something rotten.
zh: 我闻到一股腐烂的味道。

en: Let me know if you are in need of anything.
Don't hesitate to tell me if you need anything.
zh: 有什么需要直接告诉我，别客气。

en: Please bring me some medicine for airsickness.
What tempted him to propose to her?
zh: 到底是什么让他想去跟她求婚？

en: What made her do such a thing?
What tempted him to come home?
If you have some troubles, I recommend you confer with him.
zh: 如果你有什么麻烦，我建议你跟他商量商量。

en: Please give me something hot to drink.
May I have something hot to drink?
Do you have anything hot?
Time will pass quite quickly when you read something.
zh: 读起书来时间过得很快。

en: Lend me some books to read.
I want something to read.
Are you doing anything special?
zh: 你在忙什么特别的事吗？

en: Do you have anything to say in particular?
zh: 你有什么特别想说的吗？

en: Do you have anything in mind?
Do you have anything to relieve a headache?
zh: 你有什么治头疼的药吗？

en: We must devise some means of escape.
Whatever happens, I'll stick to my principles to the bitter end.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都会坚持我的原则到底。

en: Would you like to leave a message?
May I take a message?
What is the news?
Can I please have something hot to drink?
I want something hot to drink.
He encouraged his son to do something great.
zh: 他鼓励儿子去干一番大事业。

en: What is cooking in the kitchen?
zh: 厨房里在做什么好吃的？

en: Is there anything else you would like to eat?
Is it anything serious?
Did you make any New Year's resolutions?
He's given to going overboard every time he gets a new idea.
zh: 他一有新想法就容易做过头。

en: We want something new.
Is there any fresh news?
Give me something to eat.
Can I have something to eat?
I want something to eat.
Do you have anything to eat?
Bring me something to eat.
Please give me something to eat.
Please give me something to eat. I am so hungry.
zh: 请给我点吃的，我快饿死了。

en: I'd like something to eat.
How about a bite?
Is there anything that I should not eat?
If something goes wrong, you should attend to it at once.
zh: 要是出问题了，你得马上处理。

en: Can I borrow something to write with?
I want something with which to write.
Do you have something to write with?
I need something to write with.
I want something to write on.
Give me something to write with.
Give me something to write on.
Will you give us a statement?
He did not understand what was in the way of his success in life.
zh: 他不明白是什么阻碍了他的成功。

en: Do you collect anything?
Can I help you?
I should have done something.
If something does happen, I'll just play it by ear.
zh: 要是真出事了，我就随机应变。

en: Do you have any questions?
Wire me at once, in case there should be an accident.
zh: 万一出事了，立刻给我发电报。

en: There appears to have been an accident.
I need to find out exactly what went wrong.
zh: 我得弄清楚到底哪儿出了问题。

en: I will be able to see you tomorrow unless something unexpected turns up.
zh: 除非有突发情况，否则我明天能去见你。

en: Give me something to do.
Do you subscribe to any magazines?
I think there has been some misunderstanding here.
zh: 我觉得这里面有点误会。

en: What do you want me to do?
Is there anything I can do for you?
May I say something?
If you have something to say, say it now or pipe down.
What's the cause?
As soon as we find out anything, we will contact him.
zh: 我们一有消息就会联系他。

en: I was conscious that something was missing.
I haven't heard from him these several months.
zh: 这几个月我一直没他的消息。

en: You must take up a regular occupation.
I'd like something light.
Do you have a plan?
What's worrying you?
Something terrible is about to happen.
I had a feeling that something dreadful was happening.
zh: 我当时预感到要出什么可怕的事。

en: I have a feeling that something dreadful is going to happen.
Something dreadful has happened to Miss Davidson.
Ask him if you have any doubt.
zh: 你要是拿不准就去问他。

en: What's going on?
No matter what happens, I will never change my mind.
zh: 不管发生什么，我都不会改变主意的。

en: Come what may, I am prepared for it.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都做好准备了。

en: I'll stand by you whatever happens.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都会支持你。

en: We ought to be ready for whatever comes.
zh: 我们得做好应对一切的准备。

en: He told me that whatever might happen, he was prepared for it.
zh: 他跟我说无论发生什么，他都准备好了。

en: We should obey the law no matter what happens.
zh: 无论如何我们都得守法。

en: Whatever happens, please remember I'll stand by you.
zh: 不管发生什么，请记住我会一直支持你。

en: Come what may, I'm ready for it.
zh: 随便发生什么，我都准备好了。

en: Come what may, I will never leave you.
zh: 无论如何，我都不会离开你。

en: I'll keep my word, whatever may happen.
zh: 不管发生什么，我都会遵守诺言。

en: Come what may; I won't change my mind.
zh: 不管怎么样，我都不会变卦。

en: Had he known what was about to happen, he would have changed his plan.
zh: 要是他早知道会发生什么，他肯定就改计划了。

en: What would happen?
It is unexpected what breaks out.
zh: 谁也想不到会出什么事。

en: There is no predicting what may happen.
zh: 谁也预料不到会发生什么。

en: There is no telling what will happen.
There is no knowing what may happen.
Nobody can foresee what'll happen.
zh: 谁也预见不到会发生什么。

en: There is no knowing what will happen.
zh: 谁也说不准会发生什么。

en: Had they known what was about to happen, they would have changed their plans.
zh: 要是他们早知道会出什么事，他们早就改计划了。

en: Whatever happens, keep calm.
zh: 不管发生什么，都要保持冷静。

en: I don't care what happens.
Keep on the watch for anything to come.
No matter what happens, you must not give up.
zh: 无论发生什么，你都不能放弃。

en: No matter what happens, I won't be surprised.
zh: 不管发生什么，我都不觉得奇怪。

en: I'll go no matter what.
Whatever happens, you have to stay calm.
What is going on?
I demand to know what's going on here.
zh: 我必须知道这儿到底怎么了。

en: I sensed what was happening.
I was astonished to hear what had happened.
zh: 听说了发生的事，我吃了一惊。

en: I wonder what happened.
What happened, Sally?
What's up?
I explained to her what the matter was.
zh: 我跟她解释了一下是怎么回事。

en: Do you know what happened?
I cannot account for what has happened.
zh: 我没法解释发生了什么。

en: Give me an accurate report of what happened.
zh: 跟我如实说一下到底发生了什么。

en: How did it come about?
We need a detailed description of what happened.
zh: 我们需要把发生的事详细说一下。

en: We were astonished to hear what had happened.
zh: 听说发生的事，我们都惊呆了。

en: Something may have happened to him.
Something bad's going to happen.
Have I said something to hurt your feelings?
zh: 我是不是说了什么伤你心的话？

en: I feel like eating something sweet.
I want something sweet to eat.
Are there any discount tickets for me?
Can you play any musical instruments?
Have you got any baggage?
Do you hear any sound?
Please give me something to drink.
Give me something to drink.
Will you give me something to drink?
Can I get you something to drink?
May I have something to drink?
I want something to drink.
I'd like something to drink.
Are you implying something?
Do you have an opinion?
You must persevere before you can accomplish anything great.
zh: 想做成大事，你得坚持下去。

en: What is the matter with you?
Did you eat anything bad?
zh: 你是不是吃错什么东西了？

en: Something bad may happen to him.
Something wrong was about to happen.
You don't seem to understand how difficult it is for young people today to believe in something.
zh: 你好像不明白现在的年轻人要相信点什么有多难。

en: To record something, they used knotted cords made of the wool of the llama or alpaca.
zh: 为了记录事情，他们用羊驼毛做的绳子打结来记事。

en: If you say that you cannot help doing something, you mean you cannot prevent or avoid it.
zh: 如果你说你忍不住做某事，意思就是你控制不住自己。

en: Give me a ring if you find out anything.
zh: 发现什么了给我打个电话。

en: What shall I begin with?
Do you have any good news?
Come what may, we must do our duty.
zh: 无论发生什么，我们都要尽到职责。

en: Before buying anything, you had better ask yourself whether you cannot do without it.
zh: 买东西之前，最好问问自己是不是没它不行。

en: Do you have any further questions to ask?
I'll let you know if anything comes up.
zh: 有什么情况我会通知你的。

en: Show me some others.
What did Bell invent?
Is there anything else you want me to do?
What was invented by Bell?
zh: 什么东西是贝尔发明的？

en: Do you have any pets?
I'll give you a present.
The doctors said he would never again be able to walk without some support.
zh: 医生说他要是没人扶着，以后再也没法走路了。

en: Complaining about something is one way to adapt yourself to a new environment.
zh: 抱怨是适应新环境的一种方式。

en: Can't we use a simile here?
I saw something very bright fly across the night sky.
zh: 我看到夜空里有个亮闪闪的东西飞了过去。

en: What is missing?
Something's got to give.
Would you like anything to eat?
What made you so dissatisfied?
zh: 是什么让你这么不满意的？

en: What is in the desk?
What makes you so dissatisfied?
zh: 是什么让你这么不满意？

en: Don't you have anything to do?
What is over there?
Do you play any sports?
Did you make anything I can start on now?
zh: 你准备了什么我现在就能开始做的事情吗？

en: I have to do something.
Something must be done!
Let's play something.
If there is anything you want, don't hesitate to ask me.
zh: 你想要什么尽管跟我说。

en: Will you leave a message?
Do you have anything further to say?
Lend me something with which to cut this.
zh: 借我个东西切一下这个。

en: Something stinks here.
Lend me something with which to cut the string.
zh: 借我个东西剪一下绳子。

en: Be sure to get in touch with me, if there is anything I can do for you.
zh: 要是有什么我能帮上忙的，一定要联系我。

en: Don't you smell something burning in the next room?
zh: 你没闻到隔壁房间有烧焦的味道吗？

en: I felt something crawling on my back.
zh: 我感觉背上有东西在爬。

en: I heard something fall to the ground.
zh: 我听到有东西掉地上了。

en: Something went off with a loud noise.
zh: 有什么东西发出了巨大的响声。

en: I felt something touch my feet.
zh: 我感觉有东西碰了我的脚。

en: If anything is sacred the human body is sacred.
zh: 如果有什么是神圣的，那就是人的身体。

en: I smell something burning.
zh: 我闻到了一股烧焦的味道。

en: I felt something crawling up my arm.
zh: 我感觉有东西在我胳膊上爬。

en: Something is being looked for.
It's no good waiting for something to happen; you must take action at once.
zh: 干等着没用，你必须立刻采取行动。

en: Has anything strange happened?
zh: 发生什么奇怪的事了吗？

en: Something happened and he couldn't keep his promise.
zh: 出了点事，他没法遵守诺言了。

en: I hope I can be of some help to you.
Can I do anything for you?
I told her that if I could be of any use I would be glad to help.
zh: 我告诉她只要我能帮上忙，我会很乐意帮她的。

en: What shall I do for you?
If you find an interesting book, please buy it for me.
zh: 如果你看到什么有趣的书，请帮我买一本。

en: Lend me something interesting to read.
You should put something in your stomach before you go.
zh: 你走之前应该吃点东西垫垫肚子。

en: Do we have anything I can snack on?
zh: 咱们有什么能当零嘴的东西吗？

en: Go and see for yourself what has happened.
zh: 你自己去看看发生什么了吧。

en: Something strange caught my eye.
zh: 一件奇怪的东西引起了我的注意。

en: What makes you laugh like that?
Press the red button if something strange happens.
zh: 要是出了什么怪事，就按那个红按钮。

en: What are you laughing at? It's a fact. No kidding!
zh: 你笑什么？这是事实，没开玩笑！

en: What do you suggest?
I feel that something is wrong.
Have you found any good solution?
zh: 你找到什么好的解决办法了吗？

en: I need some good advice.
I had a hunch something pleasant was going to happen.
zh: 我预感到会有好事发生。

en: What's the good news?
What kind of part-time job do you have?
What made you come here?
I will be glad, if I can be of any service to you.
I am wondering if I could be of any service to you.
zh: 我看能不能帮上点什么忙。

en: Is there anything you can do?
What led you to believe so?
Is there anything that I can do for you?
zh: 有什么我可以帮你的吗？

en: I wish that I could give you something.
zh: 我真希望能给你点什么。

en: What is it that "isn't only you"?
Nothing can ever stagger her belief.
zh: 没什么能动摇她的信念。

en: Nothing will stop his going.
What prevented you from coming to the concert?
I shall not change my mind, whatever happens.
zh: 不管发生什么，我都不会改变主意的。

en: Hey, what happened?
Please keep me informed.
If something happens, feel free to call me.
zh: 要是出什么事了，尽管给我打电话。

en: I have some idea of what happened.
zh: 我大概知道发生什么了。

en: Please tell me what happened off the record, of course.
zh: 跟我说说出什么事了呗，当然，我不会跟别人说的。

en: Is anything up?
Anything new?
Did you notice any change?
zh: 你察觉到什么变化了吗？

en: Well, you have only to ask for his help.
zh: 你只要找他帮忙就行了。

en: There is no point in pretending to be sick.
We cannot conceive science without a hypothesis.
I have false nearsightedness.
Attached is the tentative agenda.
You'll need a temporary bridge.
If it were to rain tomorrow, the match would be postponed.
zh: 万一明天要是下雨，比赛就推迟。

en: If you were to win the lottery, what would you buy with the money?
zh: 要是你中了彩票，你想买点啥？

en: Were the earth to stop revolving, what do you suppose would happen?
zh: 要是地球停止转动了，你觉得会发生什么？

en: If the sun were to rise in the west, I wouldn't change my mind.
zh: 就算太阳从西边出来，我也不会改主意的。

en: What would you do if war were to break out?
zh: 要是爆发战争了，你会怎么办？

en: If I were to be born again, I would be a musician.
zh: 如果有下辈子，我一定要当个音乐家。

en: If I were to tell you the truth, you would be surprised.
zh: 要是我跟你说实话，你肯定会吓一跳。

en: If I should be late getting home, please don't wait up for me.
zh: 要是我回家晚了，你就别等我了。

en: If we were to live on the moon, how large would the earth look?
zh: 要是我们住在月球上，地球看着会有多大？

en: Were I to die, who would look after my children?
zh: 万一我不在了，谁来照顾我的孩子？

en: If I were you, I would go home and take a good rest.
zh: 我要是你的话，就回家好好休息一下。

en: Even if I grant that what you say is true, it is no excuse.
zh: 就算你说的是真的，那也不是借口。

en: Granted that you are right, we still have to persuade him first.
zh: 就算你是对的，咱们也得先说服他。

en: If I were to go abroad, I would go to France.
zh: 要是出国的话，我想去法国。

en: If he wants to succeed at all, he must work harder.
zh: 他要是真想成功，就得更努力才行。

en: Whatever is worth doing at all, is worth doing well.
Granting that it is so, what follows?
If I were to tell you the whole truth, you would be amazed.
zh: 我要是把真相全告诉你，你肯定会大吃一惊。

en: If UFOs were to attack the earth, what would become of us?
zh: 要是外星人进攻地球，我们该怎么办？

en: Fossil fuels won't be available forever.
zh: 化石燃料迟早会用完的。

en: I got a rash from cosmetics.
zh: 我用化妆品过敏起疹子了。

en: Fossil fuel prices shot through the roof.
zh: 化石燃料的价格涨疯了。

en: Ayako's skin is sensitive to chemicals.
zh: 绫子的皮肤对化学品很敏感。

en: Chemical products account for approximately two-thirds of our exports.
zh: 化工产品大概占了我们出口额的三分之二。

en: Chemical companies are waiting until everything dies down before reinvesting.
zh: 化工厂都在观望，想等风头过了再重新投资。

en: I have some acquaintance with chemistry.
I would like to consider the implications we can draw from the application of Emmet's theory to chemistry.
zh: 我想看看把埃米特理论应用在化学上能有什么启发。

en: He is a mean fellow.
Here's some medicine for diarrhea.
I have a touch of diarrhea.
I have diarrhea.
My lower abdomen feels bloated.
He haunts the lowest resorts.
zh: 他总爱混迹在那些不三不四的地方。

en: Did you do your homework? The meeting is only two days away.
zh: 你功课做好了吗？离会议只有两天了。

en: I got soaked to the skin.
You can wear your undershirt.
Translate the underlined part.
Correct the underlined words.
Translate the underlined sentences.
The drain is running freely.
The drains are blocked up.
The boarders are now away on vacation.
zh: 住校生现在都放假回家了。

en: A bad workman quarrels with his tools.
Take care not to make a foolish move.
A bad workman complains of his tools.
zh: 活儿干不好只会埋怨工具。

en: A bad workman always blames his tools.
zh: 差劲的工匠总爱赖工具不好。

en: We wish to advise you of the following price reductions.
zh: 我们要通知您，接下来的价格会有所下调。

en: We shipped the following to you last week.
zh: 我们上周给您发了下面这些货。

en: I'd like a quote on the following.
zh: 我想给下面这些东西询个价。

en: Simply follow the instructions below, and in no time you will be printing full color documents just as easily and quickly as black and white.
zh: 只要照着下面的说明做，很快你就能像印黑白件一样，又快又方便地打印彩色文档了。

en: The Representative said he will put a brake on spending.
The House cut the budget for foreign aid.
zh: 众议院削减了对外援助的预算。

en: The Congressmen rammed the bill through committee.
zh: 议员们强行让委员会通过了这项提案。

en: Go downstairs and have a wash.
See below.
Can you see something red down below?
zh: 你能看到下面有个红色的东西吗？

en: Sign at the bottom, please.
Turn down the volume, please.
Reading aloud was a great effort to him.
zh: 大声朗读对他来说挺费劲的。

en: What passion cannot music raise and quell?
zh: 音乐能唤起也能平息什么样的激情呢？

en: I hope there are some music clubs.
zh: 我希望有一些音乐社团。

en: I am interested in listening to music.
Not a sound was to be heard in the concert hall.
The concert was well attended.
The concert was a great success.
The concert will take place next Sunday.
The concert concluded with the national anthem.
zh: 音乐会最后以奏国歌结束。

en: There were many late arrivals at the concert.
The musician shook his head and pushed his little piano away.
zh: 那个音乐家摇了摇头，把他的小钢琴推到了一边。

en: A musician can appreciate small differences in sounds.
zh: 音乐家能听出声音里细微的差别。

en: Musicians are usually sensitive to criticism.
zh: 音乐家通常对批评比较敏感。

en: Did you come from a musical family?
zh: 你是出身于音乐世家吗？

en: The musician left his family poor.
zh: 那个音乐家去世时，家里还是一贫如洗。

en: Do you know when the musician will come here?
zh: 你知道那位音乐家什么时候来吗？

en: Who that understands music could say his playing was good?
zh: 懂音乐的人谁会说他弹得好啊？

en: I came to this country for the purpose of studying music.
zh: 我来这个国家是为了学音乐。

en: I cheered myself up by listening to music.
zh: 我听音乐让自己开心起来。

en: Try to reproduce the music in your mind.
zh: 试着在脑子里回想那段音乐。

en: It is a lot of fun to listen to music.
Do you like listening to music or singing songs?
zh: 你喜欢听音乐还是唱歌？

en: I listen to music.
Let's listen to some music.
Music has settled her nerves.
Music has charms to soothe a savage breast.
zh: 音乐有安抚人心的魔力。

en: Few things give us as much pleasure as music.
zh: 很少有东西能像音乐那样带给我们这么多快乐。

en: Music gives sound to fury, shape to joy.
zh: 音乐让愤怒有了声音，让快乐有了形状。

en: Music feeds our imagination.
zh: 音乐丰富了我们的想象力。

en: Music is a common speech for humanity.
zh: 音乐是人类通用的语言。

en: Music gratifies the ears.
Music makes our life happy.
zh: 音乐让我们的生活变得快乐。

en: The music added to our enjoyment.
zh: 音乐增加了我们的乐趣。

en: Music affords us much pleasure.
zh: 音乐给了我们很多快乐。

en: Music surrounds our lives like air.
zh: 音乐就像空气一样围绕着我们的生活。

en: Music moves the feelings.
Are you fond of music?
Nobody is equal to this young woman in the field of music.
zh: 在音乐领域，没人比得上这个年轻女性。

en: Our music teacher advised me to visit Vienna.
zh: 我们的音乐老师建议我去维也纳看看。

en: The importance of music is underrated.
zh: 音乐的重要性被低估了。

en: You have good taste in music.
Musical talent usually blooms at an early age.
zh: 音乐天赋通常很小就显现出来了。

en: Musical talent can be developed if it's properly trained.
zh: 只要训练得当，音乐天赋是可以培养的。

en: Talent for music runs in their blood.
zh: 他们家的人天生就有音乐基因。

en: Who that understands music could say his playing is good?
zh: 懂音乐的人谁会说他弹得好啊？

en: How do I fix the volume?
Music is universal.
They were dancing with the music.
With regards to music, he is one of the most famous critics.
zh: 说到音乐，他是最著名的评论家之一。

en: Tastes in music vary from person to person.
zh: 每个人的音乐品味都不一样。

en: Music and art can greatly contribute to the enjoyment of life.
zh: 音乐和艺术能给生活增添很多乐趣。

en: Talking of music, what kind of music do you like?
zh: 说到音乐，你喜欢什么样的？

en: When it comes to music I have no ear for it.
zh: 说到音乐，我可是一窍不通。

en: In music or speaking, a pause is frequently used for dramatic effect.
zh: 在音乐或演讲中，经常会用停顿来制造戏剧效果。

en: The music made the show.
I hear music.
He yields to nobody in love of music.
zh: 论对音乐的热爱，他不输给任何人。

en: Above the music, I could hear her crying.
zh: 盖过音乐声，我能听到她在哭。

en: Were it not for music, the world would be a dull place.
zh: 要是没有音乐，这世界该多乏味啊。

en: If not for music, the world would be a dull place.
zh: 要是没有音乐，世界会变得很沉闷。

en: Still waters run deep.
No music, no life.
Don't make any noise or you'll scare the birds away.
zh: 别出声，不然会把鸟吓跑的。

en: Don't make any noise, I'm studying.
Don't make a noise.
Can you keep the noise down?
Leaves were dropping silently to the ground.
zh: 树叶悄无声息地飘落在地上。

en: The noise was deadened by the insulation.
The music gradually died away.
The noise grew fainter, till it was heard no more.
zh: 噪音越来越小，直到听不见了。

en: The sound became fainter and fainter, till at last it disappeared.
zh: 声音越来越微弱，最后完全消失了。

en: Sound travels very quickly.
A talking dictionary is no longer a fantasy.
zh: 会说话的词典不再是幻想了。

en: Silent waters run deep.
There are a few yachts on the calm sea.
zh: 平静的海面上有几艘游艇。

en: The thermometer reads three degrees below zero.
The thermometer stood at 37 degrees centigrade.
The thermometer is an instrument for measuring temperature.
zh: 温度计是用来测量温度的仪器。

en: The thermometer stood at 15 degrees.
The thermometer reads 10C.
The thermometer stands at 70.
What is the temperature?
It is difficult to adapt oneself to sudden changes of temperature.
zh: 很难适应气温的突然变化。

en: The temperature falls.
Many plants and crops grow here thanks to the mild climate.
zh: 多亏了温和的气候，这里生长着许多植物和庄稼。

en: The hot spring will do you good.
They say you should consult the past if you want to learn about the future. History has a lot to teach us.
zh: 都说想要了解未来就得借鉴历史，历史确实能教给我们很多东西。

en: Can I fix you a hot drink?
There's nothing like a good hot bath.
zh: 没什么比洗个热水澡更舒服的了。

en: I want to eat warm soup.
Let's eat while the food is warm.
I'm looking for a warm, woolen skirt.
zh: 我想找一条暖和的羊毛裙子。

en: It is beneath my dignity to ask a favor.
zh: 求人帮忙有失我的身份。

en: You bit the hand that fed you.
Wholesale prices had been basically flat.
zh: 批发价基本上没怎么变动。

en: The wholesalers might try to back out of the deal.
Don't put me in the same class with them.
zh: 别把我跟他们混为一谈。

en: Don't fall in love because we hate you still.
zh: 别谈恋爱，因为我们还是讨厌你。

en: Cleanse me! Release me! Set me free!
zh: 净化我！解救我！还我自由！

en: You left me in despair.
Do you enjoy making me feeling like the dead?
zh: 你很喜欢让我感觉自己像死了一样吗？

en: Don't make light of me.
I guess I've reached the age where I have to dispense advice to my underlings.
zh: 我看我是到了该给手下人提建议的年纪了。

en: Am I slipping?
Was I really boring?
I have her in my pocket.
I gotta keep on movin'.
How should I know?
I am just a castaway on an island lost at sea.
zh: 我只是个在海上荒岛上的漂流者。

en: I will not be dictated to by some idiot in the personnel department.
zh: 我才不会被人事部那些白痴指手画脚。

en: I think you and he wanna be alone.
zh: 我觉得你和他想单独待一会儿。

en: I'm a free man.
I'm living in the city.
I don't wanna clean up dog shit.
I am incomplete.
I'm a hero.
I cried all night long.
